details:
Following CVEs were reported against the jackson-databind source package:


* [CVE-2020-10968](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10968)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.aoju.bus.proxy.provider.remoting.RmiProvider (aka bus-proxy).
* [CVE-2020-10969](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10969)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 javax.swing.JEditorPane.
* [CVE-2020-11111](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11111)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.apache.activemq.\* (aka activemq-jms, activemq-core,
 activemq-pool, and activemq-pool-jms).
* [CVE-2020-11112](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11112)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.apache.commons.proxy.provider.remoting.RmiProvider
 (aka apache/commons-proxy).
* [CVE-2020-11113](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11113)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.apache.openjpa.ee.WASRegistryManagedRuntime (aka openjpa).
* [CVE-2020-11619](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11619)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.springframework.aop.config.MethodLocatingFactoryBean
 (aka spring-aop).
* [CVE-2020-11620](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11620)
FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the
 interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to
 org.apache.commons.jelly.impl.Embedded (aka commons-jelly).


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
2.4.2-2+deb8u14.


We recommend that you upgrade your jackson-databind packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
